meanings.definition: Organizing or arranging according to a plan or system.
meanings.sent1: She is methodizing her study schedule for the upcoming exams.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys methodizing his tools in the garage to keep everything neat.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was methodizing its acorn collection in a very particular way.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was methodizing the chaos of the classroom into a well-structured learning environment.
meanings.sent5: The chef was methodizing the ingredients, creating a masterpiece dish.

meanings.sent1: The librarian is methodizing the books on the shelves by genre.
meanings.sent2: The scientist is methodizing the data to draw meaningful conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The robot was methodizing the factory floor, ensuring everything was in its place.
meanings.sent4: The artist was methodizing the colors on the palette before starting the painting.
meanings.sent5: The coach was methodizing the team's plays for the upcoming game.
